ongoing_events.summary: ⛺Venice Arts Summer Media Arts Camp
ongoing_events.location: Venice Arts, 13445 Beach Ave, Marina Del Rey, CA 90292, USA
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Youth ages 9–18.

Venice Arts is excited to welcome students back for our in-person Media Arts Summer Camp, a fun-filled and creative two-week workshop series designed for youth ages 9–18.

Participants will engage in hands-on media arts experiences, with access to professional equipment, exciting field trips, and the chance to build friendships while expressing creativity.

Session Dates:
Session 1: July 7 – July 18
Session 2: July 22 – August 1

Monday, July 7, 2025 2:30 PM — Friday, August 1, 2025 3:30 PM


Program Highlights:
Hands-on art and media projects
Use of professional cameras and equipment
Engaging field trips
A chance to make new friends
An inspiring space to build creative skills

Cost:
Free for low-income families

Lunch options are available for students attending full-day sessions.

Don't miss this opportunity to give your child an unforgettable summer filled with creativity, discovery, and connection.

Register today at: www.venicearts.org/summer-camp

Questions? Contact us at info@venice-arts.org or call (310) 392-0846

ongoing_events.summary: 🏕️'Outdoor Fun' Summer Camp for Kids (July) with Long Beach Boot Camp
ongoing_events.location: 5355 East Eliot Street Long Beach, CA 90803 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Kids ages 4-7
LOCATION: 5355 East Eliot Street Long Beach, CA 90803 


Affordable, Flexible & Fun Camp for Kids ages 4-7 in Long Beach. From obstacle courses to singing, dancing, arts and crafts!

'OUTDOOR FUN' SUMMER KIDS CAMP (ages 4-7)

Looking for an engaging and flexible summer camp for your little ones? Our Outdoor Fun Summer Camp offers a variety of activities designed to keep your children active, creative, and happy! In the summer we bring the 'fitness fun' to kids again! 👟👟👟

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

  • Games & Relays
  • Arts & Crafts
  • Singing & Dancing
  • Obstacle Course & Yoga

Refreshments & Snacks Provided

*AGE RANGE: We understand that every child is unique. If your child is slightly under 4 years old or older than 7, please contact us to discuss their participation.

WHY CHOOSE OUR CAMP?

Our 'Outdoor Fun' Summer Camp is:

  • open to smaller kids (from age 4 to 7)
  • small group setting (for safety & comfort)
  • affordable (from $35/day, 2nd child discount)
  • flexible (join us for a day, two or the entire week)
  • in a beautiful outdoor setting with lots of space around

REGISTER TODAY TO SECURE YOUR SPOT! 

Get tickets here.

Fill your kids' summer with fun, learning, and new friendships!

Limited capacity so save your child's spot! We prefer a small group setting to ensure children's safety. Registration will close once the capacity is reached.

Contact us with questions if you have any:

562-343-5230 (text or call) or email info@longbeachbootcamp.com

Let's have some fun! We can't wait to see your kiddo(s) at the camp.

ongoing_events.summary: 🐻Animal Adventures [Wallis Annenberg Petspace Summer Camp]
ongoing_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-11

Your kids will have an amazing summer while they immerse themselves in everything pet-related during our one week camp experience!

Summer sessions of our ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP take place Monday-Friday from 9am-2pm.  Campers will take part in fun pet-centric activities that teach them all about the human-animal bond, pet adoption, veterinary care, animal behavior and much, much more!

Animal Adventures Camp sessions:

  • June 23- June 27
  • July 14 - July 18
  • July 28 - August 1
  • August 4 - August 8

ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP themes include:

  • Adoption
  • Health
  • Behavior
  • Care
  • Nutrition
  • Habitats
  • Ecology
  • Biology

Individual days will focus and dig deep into the differences and unique qualities that mammals, birds, and reptiles have.

Daily itineraries incorporate a new theme that makes the most of PetSpace's interactive indoor and ourtdoor spaces with live demonstrations from industry professionals, crafts, educational games, and more. Campers will meet a variety of our ambassador animals from the PetSpace Critter Corner and learn how to be responsible pet owners to these unique creatures.

Visit petspacecamp.org for more information and the daily schedule.

CANCELLATION POLICY

For cancellations made at least 14 days prior to the first day of camp, a 100% refund will be issued.

Cancellations made less than 14 days prior to the first day of camp will receive a 50% refund.

To cancel your camp reservation, email: camp@annenbergpetspace.org.

Please include the following information:

  • Parent/guardian name
  • Camper's name
  • Camp dates
  • Camp confirmation number
  • Phone number

Annenberg PetSpace reserves the right to cancel any program. In the event that a program is canceled, all program fees will be refunded.

  • Preschool camp: ages 2–4.5 (with prior Spanish exposure) 
  • Elementary camp: ages 4.5–11 for older kids 


Immersion Approach: 100% Spanish-speaking setting using play, project-based learning, STEAM, cultural exploration, and music—intended to develop oral fluency in real-life contexts .

Aligned with Montessori, Reggio Emilia, and IB (PYP) methodologies

📅 Weekly Themes & Dates (2025)

Preschool sessions run June–August with rotating themes—each one week long. Highlights include:

  • June 9–13: Planet Superheroes – nature, recycling, eco-stewardship
  • June 23–27: Gaudí & Barcelona (art-focused) and Asian Trip Around the World
  • June 30–July 3: South American Experience
  • July 7–11: Exploring Gravity
  • July 14–18: Forces in Action (motion sciences)
  • July 21–25: Full Speed Ahead (speed & racing elements)
  • July 28–August 1: World of Bugs (nature-themed exploration)
  • August 4–8: Central American Experience
  • August 11–15: Italy – da Vinci & Michelangelo
  • August 18–22: Splish Splash (water science & play)
🕘 Schedule & Daily Flow

Regular Day: 9:00 AM–3:00 PM

Extended Day: 8:00 AM–5:30 PM 

Daily schedule includes arrival, theme introduction, snack, STEAM or creative activity, cultural exploration/cooking/movement, lunch/free play, more games/music, and pick-up time.

Fridays often feature a special activity or field trip (elementary camp) 

💰 Pricing & Fees

Weekly Rates (Preschool):
Regular Day: $420/week
Extended Day: $480/week Intiwasi School+3Intiwasi School+3ActivityHero+3

Additional costs:

Enrollment Fee: $25
Camp Shirt: $15 (required if participating in field trips)
Field Trip or Performance Fees: Vary per week
Hot Lunch Program: Optional—$45/week Intiwasi School

Enrollment is first‑come, first‑serve, spots fill quickly .


📍 Location & Contact

Address: 9017 W Pico Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90035 

Email: admissions@intiwasischool.com

Phone: (424) 527‑0098

Explore with your little artist! Children will learn about elements of art like shape, color and line while experimenting with various materials like paint, paper, glue, mixed media and colors. one_time_events.summary: 🧸🧘Yogi Bears Yoga [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 2 - 6 years (adult optional)

ABOUT THIS CLASS:
A ZOOGA YOGA® signature class! Come with us on an imaginative yoga adventure around the world. Little Yogis will develop their focus, strength, flexibility and coordination in this fun, ACTIVE themed yoga class. Kids practice the basics of a real yoga routine through the use of playful yoga games, easy yoga postures, our very own Zooga music, our interactive ANIMAL WALL and custom yoga mats. Students also learn breathing, meditation and visualization techniques, a sense of self and respect for others in our fun, positive environment. All skill and experience levels welcome, join at any time.

CLASS TIME: 45 minutes

PLEASE NOTE: This class is "adult optional". If joining class with your child, we ask that you participate with your child to create a better experience for all. You are welcome to stay in the lobby, if you do not join class.

**BOOK HERE**


ALL CLASSES REQUIRE 1 PARENT/CAREGIVER TO REMAIN AT THE STUDIO AT ALL TIMES, PLEASE.

one_time_events.summary: 🐼🧘Mighty Pandas Yoga & Mindfulness [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-14 years (parent optional)

ABOUT THE CLASS:
Experience a signature class from ZOOGA YOGA®! Our Mighty Pandas class is designed to help older yogis cultivate focus, strength, self-esteem, mindfulness, and coordination in a supportive environment. We encourage yogis to connect with their breath, push their boundaries, and build confidence through movement. These thoughtfully crafted classes are inspired by empowering quotes, music, and yoga principles. Explore deeper self-awareness in our parent-optional, multi-level class. Enhance your balance, strength, and flexibility while learning to move with intention and discover inner peace. This class is open to all skill levels, from athletes to beginners. Feel free to join at any time and start your yoga journey.

CLASS TIME: 45 minutes

PLEASE BRING: Yoga mat

NOTE (Parents): Please do not leave studio without checking with the front desk first.

ongoing_events.summary: 🐻Animal Adventures [Wallis Annenberg Petspace Summer Camp]
ongoing_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-11

Your kids will have an amazing summer while they immerse themselves in everything pet-related during our one week camp experience!

Summer sessions of our ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP take place Monday-Friday from 9am-2pm.  Campers will take part in fun pet-centric activities that teach them all about the human-animal bond, pet adoption, veterinary care, animal behavior and much, much more!

Animal Adventures Camp sessions:

  • June 23- June 27
  • July 14 - July 18
  • July 28 - August 1
  • August 4 - August 8

ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP themes include:

  • Adoption
  • Health
  • Behavior
  • Care
  • Nutrition
  • Habitats
  • Ecology
  • Biology

Individual days will focus and dig deep into the differences and unique qualities that mammals, birds, and reptiles have.

Daily itineraries incorporate a new theme that makes the most of PetSpace's interactive indoor and ourtdoor spaces with live demonstrations from industry professionals, crafts, educational games, and more. Campers will meet a variety of our ambassador animals from the PetSpace Critter Corner and learn how to be responsible pet owners to these unique creatures.

Visit petspacecamp.org for more information and the daily schedule.

CANCELLATION POLICY

For cancellations made at least 14 days prior to the first day of camp, a 100% refund will be issued.

Cancellations made less than 14 days prior to the first day of camp will receive a 50% refund.

To cancel your camp reservation, email: camp@annenbergpetspace.org.

Please include the following information:

  • Parent/guardian name
  • Camper's name
  • Camp dates
  • Camp confirmation number
  • Phone number

Annenberg PetSpace reserves the right to cancel any program. In the event that a program is canceled, all program fees will be refunded.

ongoing_events.summary: ☀️Spanish Immersion Summer Camp [PRE-K - 5TH GRADE]

Aligned with Montessori, Reggio Emilia, and IB (PYP) methodologies

📅 Weekly Themes & Dates (2025)

Preschool sessions run June–August with rotating themes—each one week long. Highlights include:

  • June 9–13: Planet Superheroes – nature, recycling, eco-stewardship
  • June 23–27: Gaudí & Barcelona (art-focused) and Asian Trip Around the World
  • June 30–July 3: South American Experience
  • July 7–11: Exploring Gravity
  • July 14–18: Forces in Action (motion sciences)
  • July 21–25: Full Speed Ahead (speed & racing elements)
  • July 28–August 1: World of Bugs (nature-themed exploration)
  • August 4–8: Central American Experience
  • August 11–15: Italy – da Vinci & Michelangelo
  • August 18–22: Splish Splash (water science & play)
🕘 Schedule & Daily Flow

Regular Day: 9:00 AM–3:00 PM

Extended Day: 8:00 AM–5:30 PM 

Daily schedule includes arrival, theme introduction, snack, STEAM or creative activity, cultural exploration/cooking/movement, lunch/free play, more games/music, and pick-up time.

Fridays often feature a special activity or field trip (elementary camp)

Enrollment Fee: $25

Enrollment is first‑come, first‑serve, spots fill quickly .

ongoing_events.summary: 🏕️'Outdoor Fun' Summer Camp for Kids (July) with Long Beach Boot Camp
ongoing_events.location: 5355 East Eliot Street Long Beach, CA 90803 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Kids ages 4-7
LOCATION: 5355 East Eliot Street Long Beach, CA 90803 


Affordable, Flexible & Fun Camp for Kids ages 4-7 in Long Beach. From obstacle courses to singing, dancing, arts and crafts!

'OUTDOOR FUN' SUMMER KIDS CAMP (ages 4-7)

Looking for an engaging and flexible summer camp for your little ones? Our Outdoor Fun Summer Camp offers a variety of activities designed to keep your children active, creative, and happy! In the summer we bring the 'fitness fun' to kids again! 👟👟👟

ACTIVITIES INCLUDE:

  • Games & Relays
  • Arts & Crafts
  • Singing & Dancing
  • Obstacle Course & Yoga

Refreshments & Snacks Provided

*AGE RANGE: We understand that every child is unique. If your child is slightly under 4 years old or older than 7, please contact us to discuss their participation.

WHY CHOOSE OUR CAMP?

Our 'Outdoor Fun' Summer Camp is:

  • open to smaller kids (from age 4 to 7)
  • small group setting (for safety & comfort)
  • affordable (from $35/day, 2nd child discount)
  • flexible (join us for a day, two or the entire week)
  • in a beautiful outdoor setting with lots of space around

REGISTER TODAY TO SECURE YOUR SPOT! 

Get tickets here.

Fill your kids' summer with fun, learning, and new friendships!

Limited capacity so save your child's spot! We prefer a small group setting to ensure children's safety. Registration will close once the capacity is reached.

Contact us with questions if you have any:

562-343-5230 (text or call) or email info@longbeachbootcamp.com

Let's have some fun! We can't wait to see your kiddo(s) at the camp.

ongoing_events.summary: 🐻Animal Adventures [Wallis Annenberg Petspace Summer Camp]
ongoing_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-11

Your kids will have an amazing summer while they immerse themselves in everything pet-related during our one week camp experience!

Summer sessions of our ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP take place Monday-Friday from 9am-2pm.  Campers will take part in fun pet-centric activities that teach them all about the human-animal bond, pet adoption, veterinary care, animal behavior and much, much more!

Animal Adventures Camp sessions:

  • June 23- June 27
  • July 14 - July 18
  • July 28 - August 1
  • August 4 - August 8

ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP themes include:

  • Adoption
  • Health
  • Behavior
  • Care
  • Nutrition
  • Habitats
  • Ecology
  • Biology

Individual days will focus and dig deep into the differences and unique qualities that mammals, birds, and reptiles have.

Daily itineraries incorporate a new theme that makes the most of PetSpace's interactive indoor and ourtdoor spaces with live demonstrations from industry professionals, crafts, educational games, and more. Campers will meet a variety of our ambassador animals from the PetSpace Critter Corner and learn how to be responsible pet owners to these unique creatures.

Visit petspacecamp.org for more information and the daily schedule.

CANCELLATION POLICY

For cancellations made at least 14 days prior to the first day of camp, a 100% refund will be issued.

Cancellations made less than 14 days prior to the first day of camp will receive a 50% refund.

To cancel your camp reservation, email: camp@annenbergpetspace.org.

Please include the following information:

  • Parent/guardian name
  • Camper's name
  • Camp dates
  • Camp confirmation number
  • Phone number

Annenberg PetSpace reserves the right to cancel any program. In the event that a program is canceled, all program fees will be refunded.

ongoing_events.summary: ☀️Spanish Immersion Summer Camp [PRE-K - 5TH GRADE]
ongoing_events.location: 9017 West Pico Boulevard Los Angeles, CA 90035
ongoing_events.description:
🎯BEST FOR:

  • Preschool camp: ages 2–4.5 (with prior Spanish exposure) 
  • Elementary camp: ages 4.5–11 for older kids 


Immersion Approach: 100% Spanish-speaking setting using play, project-based learning, STEAM, cultural exploration, and music—intended to develop oral fluency in real-life contexts .

Aligned with Montessori, Reggio Emilia, and IB (PYP) methodologies

📅 Weekly Themes & Dates (2025)

Preschool sessions run June–August with rotating themes—each one week long. Highlights include:

  • June 9–13: Planet Superheroes – nature, recycling, eco-stewardship
  • June 23–27: Gaudí & Barcelona (art-focused) and Asian Trip Around the World
  • June 30–July 3: South American Experience
  • July 7–11: Exploring Gravity
  • July 14–18: Forces in Action (motion sciences)
  • July 21–25: Full Speed Ahead (speed & racing elements)
  • July 28–August 1: World of Bugs (nature-themed exploration)
  • August 4–8: Central American Experience
  • August 11–15: Italy – da Vinci & Michelangelo
  • August 18–22: Splish Splash (water science & play)
🕘 Schedule & Daily Flow

Regular Day: 9:00 AM–3:00 PM

Extended Day: 8:00 AM–5:30 PM 

Daily schedule includes arrival, theme introduction, snack, STEAM or creative activity, cultural exploration/cooking/movement, lunch/free play, more games/music, and pick-up time.

Fridays often feature a special activity or field trip (elementary camp) 

💰 Pricing & Fees

Weekly Rates (Preschool):
Regular Day: $420/week
Extended Day: $480/week Intiwasi School+3Intiwasi School+3ActivityHero+3

Additional costs:

Enrollment Fee: $25
Camp Shirt: $15 (required if participating in field trips)
Field Trip or Performance Fees: Vary per week
Hot Lunch Program: Optional—$45/week Intiwasi School

Enrollment is first‑come, first‑serve, spots fill quickly .


📍 Location & Contact

Address: 9017 W Pico Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90035 

Email: admissions@intiwasischool.com

Phone: (424) 527‑0098

one_time_events.summary: 🥁Zoo Jam & Drum Bilingual Music [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: (10 months - 5 years) + adult


Come sing, drum and shake with your child in a high energy, fun environment that encourages improvisation and playfulness. Zoo Jam Drum class includes a mix of exciting and creative music making with many songs, rhythm beats, character development, counting, alphabet, etc. We incorporate movement activities to develop motor skills, balance and coordination. An instrument exploration component is also introduced which provides lots of tactile exposure to a variety of percussion and other musical instruments. Come get your drum on! Class is 45 minutes.
 
**If you do not see a "Book Class" or "Sign Up" button, class and waitlist are both full. Check back soon, as spots do open up!

**BOOK HERE**

one_time_events.summary: 📽️Cinemark Summer Movie Clubhouse
one_time_events.location: Cinemark Playa Vista and XD, 12746 W Jefferson Blvd Ste. 3190, Playa Vista, CA 90094, USA
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Family (Films are rated PG)

Location: Cinemark Theatres: Participating Locations. (Different Days and Start/ End Dates for Each Theatre) Cinemark Playa Vista and XD, Playa Vista, CA, 90094

Cinemark's Summer Movie Clubhouse features family-friendly films for $1.75 per person, for both adults and children. This year's program runs for 10 weeks, with titles such as The Spongebob Movie, The Wild Robot, and Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse

Screenings are every Wednesday, but some locations may opt for an additional showing on Monday and/or Thursday, hence the date range shown below.

2025 Schedule:  

June 2 - 5: The Bad Guys

June 9 -12:  The Spongebob Movie: Sponge Out of Water 

June 16 - 19: Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse

June 23 - 26: Shrek 2

June 30 - July 3: Despicable Me 4

July 7 - 10: Kung Fu Panda 4

July 14 -17 The Wild Robot

July 21 - 24: Sonic the Hedgehog 3

July 28 - 31: The Garfield Movie

August 4 - 7:  The LEGO Batman Movie

All movies are PG.



Check https://www.cinemark.com/movie-news/articles/summer-movie-clubhouse-kid-friendly-movies for participating theatres. Tickets go on sale May 15, and can be purchased either online or at the box office of any participating theatre. Visit their site to get a ticket.


**Children 11 and under should be accompanied by an adult during these showings
**It’s wise to reserve online ahead, especially for popular titles like Shrek or Spider‑Man
**Matches a “movie camp” feel with upbeat, family-friendly atmosphere and snack perks — many families treat it like a mini summer outing

one_time_events.summary: 🖐Messy Art & Sensory [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 18 mths - 6 years (adult optional)

ABOUT THE CLASS:
Explore with your little artist! Children will learn about elements of art like shape, color and line while experimenting with various materials like paint, paper, glue, mixed media and colors. We focus on fine motor skills, sensory experiences, and create themed projects. Kids have fun expressing themselves creatively and take home awesome projects!

SUPPLIES INCLUDED: Small art pieces are sometimes used in class. Parent supervision is necessary for younger children please.

PLEASE NOTE: This class is "adult optional". If joining class with your child, we ask that you participate with your child to create a better experience for all. You are welcome to stay in the lobby, if you do not join class.


ALL CLASSES REQUIRE 1 PARENT/CAREGIVER TO REMAIN AT THE STUDIO AT ALL TIMES, PLEASE.

**BOOK HERE**

one_time_events.summary: ⭐📖STAR Stories With Pam at West Los Angeles Regional Library
one_time_events.location: 11360 Santa Monica Boulevard Los Angeles, CA 90025
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Babies and Toddlers, Kids

  ✨ Join Pam for Magical Star Stories! 🌟

Get ready for a cosmic adventure with Pam at the West Los Angeles Regional Library!

⏰ Time: 12:00 PM - 02:00 PM
📍 Location: West Los Angeles Regional Library, 11360 Santa Monica Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025

Join us for enchanting stories about stars and space that will spark your child’s imagination and curiosity.  

Come three times and take home a free book!

one_time_events.summary: 🪇Zoo Jam & Play Music [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 6 wks - 5 years w/adult

ABOUT THE CLASS:
A fun, engaging music class for kids of all ages. In our music & play class, we will explore songs, rhymes, movement, percussion, ukulele and play with puppets, parachute, and more! An early exposure to music has a long list of benefits including early communication skills, bonding, motor skills (moving freely to music), self-expression, memory skills and so much more! Michelle & Kelci combine their love for music, children and teaching into a fun filled class! Come bond with your child and experience the joy and playfulness of what music has to offer! 
 
CLASS TIME: 45 minutes
 
BRING: Any musical instruments to play along
 
NOTES: 1 adult per child. If space available, additional families members will be charged.

**BOOK HERE**

one_time_events.summary: 🩰Storybook Ballet Tots Creative Ballet & Movement [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 2 1/2-5 1/2 years + adult optional

ABOUT THE CLASS:
A ZOOGA YOGA® signature class! Give your dancers a ballet experience in a yoga environment. Dancers embark on a journey through warm-up exercises, barre & center work and creative movement, all intertwined with captivating storytelling through dance. Our class incorporates enchanting props such as tutus, butterfly wings, colorful scarves and tiaras. Designed to be beginner-friendly, this lively session encourages children to nurture their creative instincts and express themselves individually through the magic of ballet and timeless Disney melodies! CLASS TIME: 45 minutes
*This class is adult optional, so we ask that you try to give your tots some time to try class independently.
*(SUNDAY CLASS) We periodically invite parents and friends to join us for performances @ the studio after class.
 
WHAT TO BRING: Dance shoes are not required, although ballet shoes are recommended.
 
PLEASE NOTE: This class is "adult optional". If joining class with your child, we ask that you participate with your child to create a better experience for all. You are welcome to stay in the lobby, if you do not join class.
 
ALL CLASSES REQUIRE 1 PARENT/CAREGIVER TO REMAIN AT THE STUDIO AT ALL TIMES, PLEASE.

**BOOK HERE**

Session 2: July 22 – August 1

An inspiring space to build creative skills

ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 3-5 + 6-9

LOCATION: Santa Monica College – Airport Arts Campus

WELCOME! New and Returning Families!

We’re thrilled to invite you to Peggy’s Kids Day Camp — where every day is packed with FUN FUN FUN and tailor-made adventures for curious, creative, and energetic kids!

ongoing_events.summary: 🐻Animal Adventures [Wallis Annenberg Petspace Summer Camp]
ongoing_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-11

Your kids will have an amazing summer while they immerse themselves in everything pet-related during our one week camp experience!

Summer sessions of our ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP take place Monday-Friday from 9am-2pm.  Campers will take part in fun pet-centric activities that teach them all about the human-animal bond, pet adoption, veterinary care, animal behavior and much, much more!

Animal Adventures Camp sessions:

  • June 23- June 27
  • July 14 - July 18
  • July 28 - August 1
  • August 4 - August 8

ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP themes include:

  • Adoption
  • Health
  • Behavior
  • Care
  • Nutrition
  • Habitats
  • Ecology
  • Biology

Individual days will focus and dig deep into the differences and unique qualities that mammals, birds, and reptiles have.

Daily itineraries incorporate a new theme that makes the most of PetSpace's interactive indoor and ourtdoor spaces with live demonstrations from industry professionals, crafts, educational games, and more. Campers will meet a variety of our ambassador animals from the PetSpace Critter Corner and learn how to be responsible pet owners to these unique creatures.

Visit petspacecamp.org for more information and the daily schedule.

CANCELLATION POLICY

For cancellations made at least 14 days prior to the first day of camp, a 100% refund will be issued.

Cancellations made less than 14 days prior to the first day of camp will receive a 50% refund.

To cancel your camp reservation, email: camp@annenbergpetspace.org.

Please include the following information:

  • Parent/guardian name
  • Camper's name
  • Camp dates
  • Camp confirmation number
  • Phone number

Annenberg PetSpace reserves the right to cancel any program. In the event that a program is canceled, all program fees will be refunded.

  • June 30–July 3: South American Experience
  • July 7–11: Exploring Gravity
  • July 14–18: Forces in Action (motion sciences)
  • July 21–25: Full Speed Ahead (speed & racing elements)
  • July 28–August 1: World of Bugs (nature-themed exploration)
  • August 4–8: Central American Experience
  • August 11–15: Italy – da Vinci & Michelangelo

one_time_events.summary: 🧺🌊Community Picnic at Annenberg Community Beach House
one_time_events.location: 415 Pacific Coast Hwy, Santa Monica, CA 90402, USA
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: All ages/family

It’s back! After a long break, the Community Picnic returns for an evening of good old-fashioned fun! 🏖️🎲

Whether you’re joining our epic tug-of-war on the sand, making crafts in the courtyard, or playing giant Jenga, giant Connect Four, or boardgames with new friends, this event is all about being together and enjoying summer evening vibes with your community.

Bring your picnic dinner, grab your friends and family—or come solo—and jump into the fun!

This free event is open to all ages. RSVPs encouraged, though not required.

Getting Here

The Annenberg Community Beach House is located at 415 Pacific Coast Hwy. Parking is available for $3 per hour or $12 per day. Please pay for parking at the machine upon your arrival. Exact change cash and credit cards are accepted. Ample bike parking is available; please bring a lock.

Access

The Annenberg Community Beach House is wheelchair accessible and ADA compliant. Two beach wheelchairs will be available for this activity. To reserve, call Guest Services at (310) 458-4904 or email beach.house@santamonica.gov. For disability related accommodations, please call Guest Services at (310) 458-4904.

ongoing_events.summary: 🐻Animal Adventures [Wallis Annenberg Petspace Summer Camp]
ongoing_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094 United States
ongoing_events.description:
BEST FOR: Ages 7-11

Your kids will have an amazing summer while they immerse themselves in everything pet-related during our one week camp experience!

Summer sessions of our ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP take place Monday-Friday from 9am-2pm.  Campers will take part in fun pet-centric activities that teach them all about the human-animal bond, pet adoption, veterinary care, animal behavior and much, much more!

Animal Adventures Camp sessions:

  • June 23- June 27
  • July 14 - July 18
  • July 28 - August 1
  • August 4 - August 8

ANIMAL ADVENTURES CAMP themes include:

  • Adoption
  • Health
  • Behavior
  • Care
  • Nutrition
  • Habitats
  • Ecology
  • Biology

Individual days will focus and dig deep into the differences and unique qualities that mammals, birds, and reptiles have.

Daily itineraries incorporate a new theme that makes the most of PetSpace's interactive indoor and ourtdoor spaces with live demonstrations from industry professionals, crafts, educational games, and more. Campers will meet a variety of our ambassador animals from the PetSpace Critter Corner and learn how to be responsible pet owners to these unique creatures.

Visit petspacecamp.org for more information and the daily schedule.

CANCELLATION POLICY

For cancellations made at least 14 days prior to the first day of camp, a 100% refund will be issued.

Cancellations made less than 14 days prior to the first day of camp will receive a 50% refund.

To cancel your camp reservation, email: camp@annenbergpetspace.org.

Please include the following information:

  • Parent/guardian name
  • Camper's name
  • Camp dates
  • Camp confirmation number
  • Phone number

Annenberg PetSpace reserves the right to cancel any program. In the event that a program is canceled, all program fees will be refunded.

one_time_events.summary: 👨‍👩‍👧‍👦Be a Maker: StoryWalk® in Centennial Park
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Kids

We're reading Be a Maker in Venice of America Centennial Park! A StoryWalk® is interactive and gets us outside together as neighbors. The story will be followed by playtime in our Sensory Space.

Outdoor walks encourage activities that build early literacy skills, like talking, making observations, and playing.

Meet at the entrance to the Library, and we will walk across the parking lot to Centennial Park. The park is accessible to strollers and wheelchairs. Hats and sunscreen are encouraged.

Please note: This exhibit is off-site, and takes place in Centennial Park (501 S Venice Blvd, Venice, CA 90291).

 “Be a Maker: StoryWalk®” is a family-friendly, outdoor literacy experience hosted in Centennial Park and presented by the Los Angeles Public Library (Abbot Kinney branch).

It features “Be a Maker” by Katey Howes, a children’s book celebrating creativity and displayed on sequential signs placed along a gentle walking path through the park. As families stroll, they pause at each station to read a page, blending storytelling with movement. 

Postcard: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1ziYR7CGYXu9oA16jQ8sC4lQcdQu0BstA
For ADA accommodations, call (213) 228-7430 at least 72 hours prior to the event.

one_time_events.summary: 🖐Messy Art & Sensory [Zooga Culver City Studio]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 18 mths - 6 years (adult optional)

ABOUT THE CLASS:
Explore with your little artist! Children will learn about elements of art like shape, color and line while experimenting with various materials like paint, paper, glue, mixed media and colors. We focus on fine motor skills, sensory experiences, and create themed projects. Kids have fun expressing themselves creatively and take home awesome projects!

SUPPLIES INCLUDED: Small art pieces are sometimes used in class. Parent supervision is necessary for younger children please.

PLEASE NOTE: This class is "adult optional". If joining class with your child, we ask that you participate with your child to create a better experience for all. You are welcome to stay in the lobby, if you do not join class.


ALL CLASSES REQUIRE 1 PARENT/CAREGIVER TO REMAIN AT THE STUDIO AT ALL TIMES, PLEASE.

**BOOK HERE**

From 10:00 AM to 12:00 PM, kids ages 5–12 can explore painting, crafts, and more in a fun and creative environment.

Each week features a new guided art project, with all supplies included!

Let your child's imagination soar at our fun-filled Kids Art Workshop!

PAINTING · CLAY · MIXED MEDIA

one_time_events.summary: 🧘👪Family Zooga Yoga Class
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: walkers - 8 years with adult


ABOUT THE CLASS: The ultimate ZOOGA YOGA® signature class! Yoga is a fun, joyful and peaceful way for families to move together mindfully. This class is an introduction to yoga with an adventure theme that focuses on FUN AND FAMILY! We begin by focusing and tuning-in, followed by a playful practice that includes animal poses, partner poses, music, games and laughs. Class ends with guided imagery and relaxation (savasana). While our adventures are centered around the kids, adults will get a good stretch too! Anyone can do it and everyone will enjoy it.
 
CLASS TIME: 45 minutes
 
BRING: Yoga mat for adults
 
NOTES: 1 adult per child. Babies in arms are no charge. If space available, additional family members will be charged.

**Check calendar and book here**

one_time_events.summary: ⚽Soccer Tots @ Park [Tellefson Park, Culver City]
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 2 - 4 1/2 years with adult


WHAT: Soccer Tots: Beginning Soccer Fundamentals

LOCATION: Tellefson Park - 11057 Washington Pl.
Culver City CA 90232


ABOUT THE CLASS:
Our soccer programs combined with Zooga’s mindful approach, emphasizes correct soccer fundamentals and techniques in fun way. Our goal is to create a positive environment and to instill our students with a sense of confidence, coordination and a love of the game. Feel free to head straight to the park and check-in with our Coach. 


CLASS TIME: 45 minutes
 
BRING: *Blanket, water bottle, sunscreen

  • Weather permitting, please check online if raining to see if cancelled. We will also send email or text if we cancel & you will not lose a class pass.

Advanced reservations required.

**BOOK HERE**

Come sing, laugh and giggle with your baby in a high energy, fun environment that encourages improvisation and playfulness. Sing childhood favs, wave colorful scarves, dance to an array of musical styles and play with our shakers and rhythm props to nurture a life long love of music while fostering social skills and enhancing coordination. The SMILES ARE INFECTIOUS!

one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: 2 - 5 years (adult optional)

ABOUT THE CLASS:
Step into a wild adventure with Mini Ninjas, where children can unleash their inner animals in a fun and energetic environment! This class combines elements of gym movements with imaginative play, inspired by the fascinating world of zoo animals. Kids will climb, swing, and balance through a series of engaging activities designed to develop their coordination, strength, and flexibility. Zoo Gym & Play encourages creativity and physical fitness through animal-themed games and exercises. It’s a roaring good time for children to explore movement in a playful setting!

one_time_events.summary: 🐾📚Paws & Pages at Annenberg PetSpace
one_time_events.location: 12005 Bluff Creek Dr Playa Vista, CA 90094
one_time_events.description:
Visit Annenberg PetSpace for an animal-centric Saturday morning experience!


Paws & Pages at Annenberg PetSpace is a delightful, free, weekly pet-themed storytime and craft event pairing young readers with adoptable animals, perfect for families, pet lovers, and curious learners.

BEST FOR: Kids of all ages

Each session lasts about 30 minutes and includes:

  • Story reading by staff, volunteers, or visiting authors using an animal‑themed children’s book. 

  • A craft activity supporting the book's theme. 

  • Meet-and-greet with a featured Critter Corner ambassador (small animals) and a chance to read to adoptable dogs or cats outside their suites.


🗓️ When & How to Join

  • Schedule: Saturdays at 11:30 am

  • Admission: Free; though occasional drop-in fee (~$3) may apply. Guests can walk in without a ticket. 

  • Registration: Tickets are available on Eventbrite; refunds allowed up to one day prior. 

💡 Tips for Visiting

  • Your well-behaved dog can join, but must stay on the ground floor and leashed. 

  • Walk‑ins welcome, but reserving a free ticket ensures entry. 

  • Combine Paws & Pages with a behind‑the‑scenes tour to learn about grooming and veterinary operations.

one_time_events.description:

Every Saturday at 12:30pm in July & August!

We are so excited to bring you our brand new Middle Grade Book Club for readers in 4th-7th grade and their parents.

Hosted by CBW manager & 2024 National Book Award for Young People's Literature chair, Brein Lopez!

one_time_events.summary: 🎵Ozomatli Concert
one_time_events.location: Burton Chace Park, 13650 Mindanao Way, Marina Del Rey, CA 90292, USA
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: Family

Now in its 25th year, Marina del Rey Summer Concert Series returns with exciting symphonic and pop concerts at beautiful Burton Chace Park.

TIME: Performances start at 7:00 p.m.

VENUE: Burton Chace Park - 13650 Mindanao Way, Marina del Rey, CA 90292

Event Details

What to Expect:

  • Alternating pop and symphony concerts, featuring acclaimed artists and the Marina del Rey Symphony.
  • Gourmet food trucks arrive at 5:00 p.m., or pack your own picnic for a classic concert-in-the-park experience.
  • Family-friendly, relaxed atmosphere-perfect for all ages.
  • No reserved seating; arrive early for the best spots.

Where to Eat  

Marina del Rey offers a wide variety of restaurants with many types of cuisine and price ranges to choose from. For a full list of dining options, go to the Marina del Rey Restaurant Map.

If you’d rather bring your own food, you can enjoy a picnic or barbecue at Burton Chace Park, which offers a limited number of public picnic tables and grills available on a first-come, first-served basis.

Getting There, Parking & Accessibility

Due to the popularity of the Summer Concert Series , expect heavy traffic delays on the roads surrounding the Marina del Rey area.

  • Public parking lots nearby the park; rates typically $7–$10.
  • The Marina del Rey WaterBus and Beach Shuttle offer convenient, scenic access on concert nights.
  • The park and shuttles are wheelchair accessible.

Public Transportation:
Take the LA Metro's C Line (formerly Green Line) to the Marina del Rey Station and catch the Culver City Bus #1 to the Marina.

Accessibility:
Burton Chace Park is accessible, with wheelchair-friendly pathways, viewing areas, and restroom facilities. Accessible parking spaces are available in all public lots.

Rideshare: For safety, rideshare drivers should not stop or park illegally to pick up or drop off passengers. Plan ahead and be ready to walk a short distance to or from your rideshare spot.

Insider Tips

  • Arrive Early: The parking lots fill up quickly, so arriving early ensures you’ll find a spot and enjoy the sunset views, sample local eats, and soak up the festive community vibe before the music begins.
  • Seating: Bring your own low-back chair or cozy blanket to ensure comfortable seating during the concert. Burton Chace Park offers open lawn areas with no reserved seats, so arriving early with your own seating helps you claim the best spot 
  • Ride the Summer WaterBus for $1 per person: Before the concert, hop on the Summer WaterBus for just $1 per person. This open-air boat stops at eight scenic locations throughout the marina-including Burton Chace Park-so you can enjoy a relaxing harbor cruise before the concert begins.

GET READY TO HOOP IT UP!

At the end of every session, we’ll crown a champion team!

one_time_events.summary: 🧘 Family Zooga Yoga Class
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: walkers - 8 years with adult


ABOUT THE CLASS: The ultimate ZOOGA YOGA® signature class! Yoga is a fun, joyful and peaceful way for families to move together mindfully. This class is an introduction to yoga with an adventure theme that focuses on FUN AND FAMILY! We begin by focusing and tuning-in, followed by a playful practice that includes animal poses, partner poses, music, games and laughs. Class ends with guided imagery and relaxation (savasana). While our adventures are centered around the kids, adults will get a good stretch too! Anyone can do it and everyone will enjoy it.
 
CLASS TIME: 45 minutes
 
BRING: Yoga mat for adults
 
NOTES: 1 adult per child. Babies in arms are no charge. If space available, additional family members will be charged.


**Check calendar and book here**

one_time_events.summary: 🐐Baby Goat + Lamb Yoga by Laughing Frog Yoga
one_time_events.location: 12217 Santa Monica Blvd, Los Angeles, CA 90025, USA
one_time_events.description:
BEST FOR: All ages; ) Children may attend class, and we have had kids as young as 5 years old participate safely. Our goats can weigh anywhere from 15-35 lbs and we can't always control where they wander or jump so please consider this as you determine what is safe for your child. All minors below 18 will need a legal guardian to fill out a liability waiver form on their behalf to attend class.

Goat yoga is "baaaah"ck, with a special twist!! We are excited to welcome new baby goats and lambs to our yoga family! Not sure what to expect - watch our featured videos on Fox11 Good Day LA, CBS Sunday Morning, & LATV.



**GRAB YOUR TICKETS HERE**

1) Limited ticket quantities available: Get your tickets while you can! Learn more on our website at: http://laughingfrogyoga.com/goat-yoga/

2) Pre-sale List: Can't make it this time? Add yourself to our pre-sale list to be the first to know when tickets go on sale.

3) Location & Animals: To maximize the comfort of humans and animals, all classes are now being held indoors at Laughing Frog Yoga. Class will feature two goats, and a miniature sheep (Frodo or his brother Samwise).

4) Parking: Follow the underground ramp which will lead you to two levels of FREE underground parking. Walk to the center of the lot where you can take the stairs or ride up the elevator

5) Cancellation Policy: We are actively turning away many people to save your spots. All sales are final and we are unable to offer refunds, credits, or date switches. If you can no longer attend class you are more than welcome to transfer your tickets to friends.

6) We specialize in goat yoga birthday parties and corporate team-building events. Please read & submit our private party info sheet to inquire. For media and filming inquiries please email us here.

7) Our Goat Yoga classes are catered towards all-levels. Beginners to advanced yogis are welcome.

8) Children may attend class, and we have had kids as young as 5 years old participate safely. Our goats can weigh anywhere from 15-35 lbs and we can't always control where they wander or jump so please consider this as you determine what is safe for your child. All minors below 18 will need a legal guardian to fill out a liability waiver form on their behalf to attend class.

9) The last 30 minutes of class is reserved for hangout/selfie time with the goats so plenty of time for photos!
